column1: shapes into the pads, slight swing on a good length, flicked uppishly to fine leg's left
swings it in from off stump at a good length, inside edge onto the pads, half-appeal
good length, swinging in from off stump, leans in, puts a pad across and pushes it aerially to mid-on
keeping that swing going. Good length, tails in from off stump, pushed back to the bowler who gestures a throw. Aggression.

good length on off, this one goes straight, he pushes it to mid-off, who has overrun. Slides as he misfields but recovers and throws it. The bails are dislodged and Gayle is short on the second run. <b>Goes upstairs. Oh dear. Gayle was 3 yards short but the bowler hasn't received the ball cleanly. Knocks the bails off with his hands.</b
angled down the leg side from middle stump
pushes this outside off, no swing from the ball as it evades the bat swing
back of a length outside off, angles in after pitching, left alone and it carries nicely
back of a length outside off, this one goes straight through, he has no interest in going after that. Left alone.
147 kph, same length, same line, same response. Shoulders arms.
139 kph, and again. He has Gayle thinking. Hitting that channel outside off. Gayle hasn't brought out the cut still. Lets another one go
back of a length, angles in at the corridor, opens his face and pushes it to point's right
142 kph, back of a length at middle, cramps him near his mid-riff and he bunts it with soft hands towards second slip
good length, angled across and slightly outside off, lets it go

133 kph, and he's had enough. This is good length and in the corridor, shuffles down the track and lifts him straight over. Didn't connect fully, which is why it didn't go out of the stadium. Six, nonetheless.
good length on middle and leg, defended towards midwicket and the bowler cuts it off
short of a length on middle, backs away and pulls it straight to deep square leg
full and on leg stump, he gets in nice shape and lifts it with a full face over mid-on
full and drifts onto the pads, pushed to square leg
uff! Good length on off, no feet as he absolutely smashes this on the up. Mid-off gets a hand on it with his dive but it still flies to the boundary
short and into his rib cage, he swivels and turns away the pull shot and old Zulfiqar puts in the big left boot after running to his left from fine leg
good length outside off, angles in and he slaps it past him, through the line, on the up and it goes through Gayle's leg and past mid-on

the bowler wins this contest. Anticipates the batsman's hard hands and throws a slower delivery wide and full, Shahzaib is through the shot before it arrives and his attempt at hitting it is just a feeble push, top edge, and Mills takes it himself
fires in a short ball at his ribs, he gets on top of it nicely and pushes it past the short leg fielder
a full slower ball and he beats him and catches him on the pads, but it hits him down the leg and looks like there was an inside edge too
full on middle, Gayle smashes it back at him and it goes past him before he can get his hands down to catch it. Can't call that a drop. Long-on gets around
full on middle, goes inside out and hits his drive in the air, just past the bowler
full toss fired in at middle stump, gets down and slogs it towards deep midwicket, one bounce
good length, angled into the pads, forward defence
good length on middle stump, gets right forward and defends
drops it short and angles it in, but has protection for a well timed whip to deep square
back of a length outside off, picks the length early and pulls it majestically past midwicket, but it's only one with Gayle at the other end
slower ball, full on the pads, waits for it and flicks it to square leg

good catch! Good length, pitches on leg  and sticks into the pitch, he goes for the flick but it climbs on him and gets him high on the bat. Balloons back to Perera who dives across the pitch to snap it up
slower ball at a yorker length on the pads, pushes it to deep square
slower ball, back of a length outside off, cuts it to cover. Perera has decided to turn to spin tonight.
back of a length on off stump, he walks cross and glances it down to fine leg
around the wicket, good length on off stump, goes back and punches to long-off
full outside off, leans in and turns it to long-on sweetly
good length on middle, pushed to midwicket
tossed up nicely on middle, goes down the track and just gets to the pitch as he drives it to long-off
good length on middle, uses the wrists again and flicks it past a diving midwicket
good length on middle, hangs back and pushes into the leg side
good length at middle stump, no turn, goes back and clips it to deep midwicket
good length, angled across the left hander from around, he pushes it back to the bowler
pushed across him, he gets back and punches it but midwicket dives and cuts out a single
good length on off, walks across and punches it to the left of midwicket
good length on middle, steps out and drives it to long-on
full on the pads, flicked down to deep square leg
full on off stump, goes forward and drives to long-on
drops it short outside off, he gets good bat on his cut and point puts in a half-hearted effort low to his right. Sweeper cover gets across but his dive won't prevent a boundary
full on the pads, pushed with soft hands into the leg side
good length on the pads, turned away to deep midwicket off the back foot
tossed up on middle, driven to long-off
goes for an arm ball,, drops it short, he gets on the back foot and punches it to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
dropped short on off stump, turns away from him and gets the bottom of the bat on his pull shot. Straight to deep midwicket
good length on middle, punched to midwicket
good length on off and he's had enough of the back foot. Steps out and slams this nice and handsomely over the midwicket boundary. Vintage Sanga
goes back and punches this good length ball to long-off
good length on off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, steps out and whips it to deep midwicket
dropped short and he leans back and slams the pull shot between deep midwicket and long-on
dropped short again, this time he goes back and slashes it to sweeper cover
fired in full on leg stump, he's premeditated the sweep, but adjusts nicely to the length to paddle it fine
good length outside off, tries to push it through the off, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
dropped short at middle stump, pulls it straight to deep mid
106 kph, slower ball, good length and wide outside off, Sanga reaches out and doesn't connect his slash. Goes straight to point
slower ball, full on leg stump, clears his front foot and slaps it past Perera, who couldn't really attempt the catch
back of a length slower ball on off stump, waits for it and drives inside out to sweeper
follows the batsman down the leg side and nails the yorker, but the soft-handed flick is good enough for him to hustle back for the second

slower ball, back of a length outside off, makes room, waits for it and connects the slash nicely, but there isn't enough pace and he doesn't have enough power to clear the field. Deep point runs in a couple of yards and takes it easily
slower ball, angled in on a good length at middle, shuffles across and pushes it to deep midwicket
full on off stump, steps out and converts it into a full toss. Carves it to sweeper cover
fires in a full toss at middle, thumped down to long-on
dropped short and hurries him as he plays the pull. Connects well but straight to the deep fielder
low full toss on the pads, driven to deep midwicket
good length outside off, steps out and drives it nicely wide of long-off who gets across nicely
full on middle stump, steps out and yorks himself. Jammed out to long-on
around the wicket, cramps him at hip-height, but he turns it down to fine leg
133 kph, bouncer directed towards his head and he ducks under it
back of the hand slower ball, good length outside off, waits for it and pokes away from the body, but is beaten
good length, tails slightly away from the batsman at off stump, he can't connect his inside-out drive and it goes on the bounce to covers
good length outside off, bottom of the bat on his attempted drive on the up, straight to cover again, who has a shy at Pollard's stumps at the non-striker's.  Nothing to report.
slower ball, back of a length outside off, cuts it straight to cover. Brilliant over, brilliants skills. He cuts his pace down about 30kph with that slower ball - from the mid-140s
backs away, gets followed, the ball is short of a good length, but no worries. He hangs back and lifts it nonchalantly off the back foot straight over the bowler
flat and fired down towards the pads, steps out and slams it on the up past his partner who has to duck quickly and is barely back up as it races away to the boundary

follows him down the leg side again and this time he gets it closer to the big man's body and gets it in on the angle. Pollard is nonchalant again as he lifts this, but it has caught the inside half of his bat and it goes straight to long-on
no hanging around for Malik! Tossed up on middle, steps out and slams it over long-on first ball
fired back of a length at his pads, stays back in the crease and turns it to fine leg
back of a length at middle, slight turn, but goes behind at hits against it as he turns it to deep square
back of a length outside off, hangs back and slogs it unceremoniously, one bounce to deep midwicket
short ball outside off, goes over his attempted pull and falls well in front of a diving Sarfraz. Pitch slowing down?
full and on the pads, eased away nicely off to deep square leg's right
good bouncer, climbing away from him outside off and his attempted pull is sliced over the bowler and down to long-on
full outside off, gets back in his crease, clears the front foot, has a huge swing at it, and hits it down to long-on for only a single
slower ball, full outside off, throws his hands at it with a slog, inside edge, past the stump, then keeper, then short fine
around the wicket, slower ball, floated generously on the pads, accepted gracefully turned away to the long leg boundary
full slower ball on off stump, jammed down to long-on
slower ball, back of a length on off stump, sliced off the back foot to point
fired full and on the pads, walks across and flicks it in front of midwicket and runs hard
low full toss, angled across from off stump, slammed back but straight to KP at long-off
low full toss at middle, stays in his crease and gets under this, but the connection isn't good enough and it is lifted straight to deep square leg
back of a length, leg cutter, steps out and has to pull out from his shot as it flies away at nose height
a conventionally paced short ball, similar line to the previous one, this time it goes under his attempted pull
attempted bouncer at middle stump, sits up nicely and he turns it past short fine
119 kph, good length, slower ball outside off, pushed into the off side off the front foot
low full toss, angled down the leg stump, awful line. Flicked away with no difficulty
full and wide outside off, slams it into the off side, but catches the bottom of the bat. Wide enough from sweeper cover to come back for a second
slower ball, good length at middle, slogged away to deep midwiwcket
slower ball at middle stump, hangs back and connects the swing nicely to lift it over deep midwicket

full and wide outside off, carved to point, throw comes in and he's short of the crease. The bails are off and lit...has he broken the stumps with his hands? Looks like it. But Babar is going anyway. Perera has it cleanly. Run out.
full and angled across off stump, takes a few steps forward and butchers it to long-off's left
full outside off, carved to sweeper cover's left and runs hard to come back for the second
wow! Walks at the bowler again, it's full and wide and he finds that spot wide of long-off again. Muscled.
full at off stump, backs way and throws his hands at it, gets the bottom of the bat and it rolls to mid-off
short and angled into the batsman, he backs away, uses the pace on his uppish hook shot, but it's straight to fine leg. Sussex gets Essex.
short of a length slower ball outside off, heaves at it, gets an inside edge and it deflects off a diving Sarfraz's gloves towards short fine
back of a length outside off, leans back and slashes hard. Asad Shafiq is parallel to the ground at point as he dives one-handed to his right and drops this Super effort
slower ball angled at the batsman, steps out and turns it to fine leg

back of a length, slower ball at off stump, gets behind and slogs into the leg side. Comes back for the second but deep midwicket has run in and thrown it nicely for Sarfraz who whips the bails off aggressively
full outside off, no swing back in, drives it with no timing, bounces to cover's right as he puts in a dive
full and wide, Amir is looking for swing, but there isn't any. Instead, it's width at nice pace for Shafiq. This time he dispatches it to cover's left
full and wide, this time it pitches and holds it's line. Goes between bat and pad as he slashes at it on the up
finds some movement, but it starts on leg stump and slides down
back of a length, angled across the corridor, defended with an angled bat
good length at middle stump, shapes in slightly, uses his wrists to turn it to fine leg without too much feet
full outside off, tails back slightly, gets the bottom of the inside half on his drive and bounces back to the bowler
drifted down the leg on a good length
fired in flat, good length on middle, steps out, doesn't get to the pitch, defends
pushed flat and short at middle, punched off the back foot to deep midwicket
good length at middle, steps out and pokes it uppishly to deep midwicket
fired in at leg stump, goes back and tries to make room to cut it, but he's cramped and jams it into the ground
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
shimmies down the leg before he delivers, makes him bowl down the leg side, pats himself on the back, smiles wide, gets on one knee and paddles it between short fine and square leg
good length outside off, fraction wide, hardly any feet, but strong wrists as he drives it on the up past cover

back of a length, he squares up to turn it down to fine leg, but it sits in the pitch and comes onto him slowly. Hits the sticker of the bat and floats up towards the bowler, but his follow through goes left and the fall lands to his right
back of a length at middle, steps down the track and lifts it's over mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot

Pollard holds his finger to his lips and says 'shhhh' after taking this. Back of a length, angles in but goes slightly out after pitching. Shehzad had already positioned himself to flick it across the line. Gets a leading edge and Pollard gobbles it at backward point

has that carried? Sangakkara doesn't know. Goes upstairs for a caught behind. Soft signal is not out. This was good length outside off, KP poked at it without feet and got a big nick. Sangakkara stretched forward and dived to take this. He looked doubtful...but it's out! Replays show he took that cleanly. Big wicket.
good length outside off, steps out and converts it into a half-volley and chips it over the bowler
good length on off, pushed to cover off the front foot
full and angled across the left hander, sliced to point
good length on off stump, pushed to mid-off
arm ball, fired flat outside off, backs away and throws his arms hard at this, but is beaten

good length outside off, gets on one knee and plays the slog sweep. It goes high and just about evades the deep midwicket fielder who does well to get a hand on it but is across the line as he tries to bob it backwards into the ground
good length on off, steps down and drives it to mid-off
3 wickets in 4 balls for Sohail! Full outside off, he slices it to try and find the gap between point and a catching backward point, put it goes uppishly and straight to the fielder at point
good length, angling in from off stump, tentative forward push and gets an inside edge onto pad
full outside off, driven to Pollard who is in a wide gully position
back of a length outside off, walks at the ball and pushes it to mid-on
good length on off stump, punches it to mid-off
back of a length, aimed at off stump, back foot defence
back of a length on off, not a bad ball, but Rossouw is in serious form. Slaps this in front of square. Deep fielder gets across nicely but stumbles as he goes down to field it
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-off on the up
pushed across the right hander at a good length, dabbed down to third man. The original dab.
full and swings into the pads, tries to whip it but only connects with and inside edge onto the pads
back of a length outside off, tries to drop it into the off side and run, but connects it too well
over the wicket, good length at middle, steps out and hits it wide of the deep fielder at the midwicket boundary
googly, good length on off and spinning away, goes back and swats it to long-on
back of a length at off stump, turns away slightly, cut to backward point
good length at middle stump, backs away and pushes into the off side
good length, tossed up at middle and it's a google again. Front foot defence
another googly, good length outside off, uses the turn and plays the reverse sweep past backward point
back of a length slower ball, full and on off, punched to deep cover's right
off cutter, angles in from a good length outside off, hangs back and turns it down late  to third man
good length outside off, turns it down to third man off the front foot this time
slower ball, cuts in at a good length from outside off, chopped to short third man
good length on off stump, goes on the back foot and pushes it to point
short and wide, backs away too much and loses his alignment for the cut. Finds the fielder
good length outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
back of a length at middle, steps out, gets a nice batswing and creams it between the deep fielders on the leg side
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length, angled into the pads and pushed into the leg side
full and outside off, gets the bottom of the bat as he chops at it. Bounces slowly to covers
slower ball, full outside off, clears the front foot and golf-lifts it over long-on for a painful six for the fielding side

wow! This is some skill. He shapes up to play a paddle sweep as Pollard is about to deliver, then hangs back. Pollard has bowled a slower ball aimed at Rossouw's crouch for the sweep, but it turns into a full toss that he slaps over long-on. Serious talent.
back of a length outside off, backs away to play a late cut, but leaves it too late. Beaten on the outside edge
fired down the leg side at a good length
back of a length on off stump, cramps him for room, cut shot goes straight to point
cramps him outside off again, but the late cut goes to point's left this time and he has to put in a dive to stop it
good length at off stump, punched off the back foot through the covers
back of the hand slower ball, good length at off stump, drops it into the infield on the off side with soft hands
shapes for the paddle sweep again, gets upright but this time he can only push it to deep midwicket
shapes for the paddle, gets back upright, drives it nicely to sweeper's left and comes back to bring up the fifty partnership
good length on the pads, goes back and pushes into the leg side
dropped short at middle stump, slapped in front of square and past deep midwicket
goes around, pushes it across on a good length outside off, pushed into the covers
follows him down the leg side, good length, turned away towards square leg
ooh close, but not out. Full and on leg stump, he tries to flick it with soft hands and it raps him on the pads. But it sounds like that was an inside edge and it's not out
back of a length outside off, goes back and punches it to long-off's right
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, wants to slam this past cover but goes at it too hard. Bat turns and it goes down to long-off
good length on off stump, hurries on him and jammed back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on the pads, pushed to deep midwicket, and second half-century in a row under pressure
short and wide outside off, cut in the air, without too much connection, but it's in the gap between point and short third man
good length on the pads, lifts one leg up in the air and whips it flambouyantly to deep square
bowled from wide of the crease, back of a length outside off, punched down to long-on
back of the hand slower ball, back of a length outside off and he steps out and slams this past the bowler and umpire. Imperial.
attempted bouncer, he squats to show the paddle again but bounces straight back up to try and ramp it as it flies at him. That looked well above his head though.
another bouncer and this time he has to get down fast as it tails back towards him. He's on the floor
slower ball, good length outside off, steps out and tries to give it the full slog treatment, but it drifts away, pitches and goes further away from him as it beats him
back of a length outside off, and at his pace, it's not a good length on this wicket. He backs away and slams it past sweeper cover's right
slower ball, back of a length, comes back at him as he backs away, and he pulls it to long-on
good length, angled into the batsman, pushed to long-on
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, hangs back and opens the face last minute to turn it down to third man
follows him down the leg side with a slower ball on a good length, Rossouw tickles it fine but short fine leg gets across and dives
short, wide and slow, slapped straight to point
back of a length at off stump, punched to covers
in the blockhole, angled down the leg, gets under his attempted flick, inside edge and onto the back pad
back of a length outside off, makes room and creams this nicely through the line. Races to sweeper's right and he puts in a slide just in time to get his body behind it
back of a length at middle, goes back and heaves, doesn't middle it and drags it over midwicket

attempted yorker, misses his length slightly outside leg, flicked between fine leg and deep square. Slight mix up and Rossouw has to scramble back and put in a dive to be sure. Referred upstairs and not out. The throw wasn't great - high and wide

short and angled into the ribs from off stump, attempted pull but he's late to it. Catches the top of his bat and it rolls into the midwicket region where Amir gets across quickly and keeps it to a single
good length outside off, chopped to short third man, and a risky single well taken
full and angled in to the pads, backs away and slaps it to mid-off's left but Imad Wasim puts in a superb dive and doesn't let it get past the infield
slower ball floated full outside off, hangs back and this time it's past covers and no amount of diving will stop this one
short and wide, cut away to deep point
back of a length at middle, goes back and pulls to deep midwicket
short and angled in, pulls it behind square, fine leg runs to his left and slides on his knees to save the boundary
low full toss from around the wicket, plays the reverse, it goes straight to short third man, who might've come close with a direct hit. Instead, it's overthrows
good length at middle stump, steps out and goes for the slog, gets an inside edge that trickles past Sanga
in the blockhole at middle stump, backs away and chops it to point
fired in at yorker length outside off, slammed down to long-off
good length at off stump, goes for a wild slog sweep, gets a leading edge that goes to long-off, they scramble back for too even as Pollard fires in a throw at the strikers end
low full toss outside leg, gets low and sweeps it over the long leg boundary to bring up his half-century
slower bouncer, angles into him after pitching, goes for the upper cut, doesn't connect. Sanga is shouting animatedly behind the stumps. Rossouw doesn't understand why.
well-directed bouncer at his neck, goes for the hook but isn't in control of this. Falls about 5 yards in front of Malik at fine leg who is running in
back of a length on the hips, swung away to fine leg

woeful running. Steps out at a good length ball, bat turns in his hand as it rolls down to Pollard at long-on. They come back for the second as he gets it in his hands and he's short by at least 6 metres as the the throw misses

full and tailing down leg, goes for the paddle and misses. That was close. Oh what's this drama? Sarfraz thought the ball's dead and walked out at the non-strikers. Imad has cheekily taken the bails off. Third umpire. Sarfraz is livid with the umpire. But replays show he just made it back.
good yorker at leg stump, couldn't do much but throw his bat at it. Inside edge and races past Sangakkara
short and wide, cut to deep point
good yorker at leg stump. Squeezes it out and turns it to short fine
back of a length outside off, and seams away after pitching. Past his outside edge as he slashes at this
full outside off and swings back in, driven to long-on's left and this is top-class running. No hesitation, loud call, and enforces a fumble from the fielder
slower ball outside off, hangs back and chops it down to third man
excellent yorker, directed at off and middle, digs it out unconvincingly to deep square. End of a great spell from Sohail.

....but there won't be a next time. Full toss outside off, slapped in front of sweeper cover and that's a second win for Quetta Gladiators. Ease past Karachi Kings by seven wickets thanks to this unbroken 130 run partnership.
